results.title: Effects of beta-adrenoceptor activation on haemodynamics during hypoxic stress in rats.
results.text_hl: Effects of beta-adrenoceptor activation on haemodynamics during @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ stress in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Possible involvement of membrane-stabilizing action in beneficial effect of beta adrenoceptor blocking agents on hypoxic and posthypoxic myocardium.
results.text_hl: In contrast, neither @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ nor @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ affected these changes induced by the @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ insult and the following reoxygenation.

citations.NLM: Takeo S, Yamada H, Tanonaka K, Hayashi M, Sunagawa N. Possible involvement of membrane-stabilizing action in beneficial effect of beta adrenoceptor blocking agents on hypoxic and posthypoxic myocardium. J Pharmacol Exp Ther. 1990 Sep;254(3):847-56. PMID: 1975623

results.title: Enhancement of post-hypoxic contractile and metabolic recovery of perfused rat hearts by dl-propranolol: possible involvement of non-beta-receptor mediated activity.
results.text_hl: Subsequent reoxygenation produced little recovery of cardiac contractile activity and tissue high-energy phosphates, further enhancement of the release of creatine kinase and the accumulation of tissue @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@. Treatment of the @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic hearts@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@dl-propranolol@@@, d-propranolol and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was performed during 5 to 15 min of @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ perfusion.

citations.NLM: Fujioka H, Yoshihara S, Tanaka T, Fukumoto T, Kuroiwa A, Tanonaka K, Hayashi M, Takeo S.
